channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Rogue wave patterns associated with Adler Moser polynomials in the nonlocal nonlinear Schrodinger equation
item.description: arXiv:2503.03757v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this work, we focus on new rogue waves patterns in the nolocal nonlinear Schrodinger (NLS) equation. Utilizing the aysmptotic analysis approach, we show that when multiple free parameters get considerably large, its rogue wave patterns can be approximately predicted by the root structures of the Adler Moser polynomials. Adler Moser polynomials, as a generalization of Yablonskii Vorob'ev polynomial hierarchies have more diverse root structures, such as heart-shaped. We divide the (x,t) plane into three regions and through the combination of asymptotic results in different regions, novel rogue wave patterns can be obtained. We also compare the predicted outcomes with true solutions both graphically and numerically to demonstrates good agreement between them.
item.dc:creator: Wang Tingyou, Qin Zhenyun, Mu Gui, Zheng Fuzhuang

item.title: Landscapes of integrable long-range spin chains
item.description: arXiv:2405.09718v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We clarify how the elliptic integrable spin chain recently found by Matushko and Zotov (MZ) relates to various other known long-range spin chains. The limit $q\to1$ gives the elliptic spin chain of Sechin and Zotov (SZ), whose trigonometric case is due to Fukui and Kawakami. At finite size, only the latter is U(1)-symmetric. We compare the resulting (vertex-type) landscape of the MZ chain with the (face-type) landscape containing the Heisenberg XXX and Haldane--Shastry (HS) chains, as well as the Inozemtsev chain and its recent q-deformation. We find that the two landscapes only share a single point: the rational HS chain. Using wrapping we show that the SZ chain is the anti-periodic version of the Inozemtsev chain in a precise sense, and expand both chains around their nearest-neighbour limits to facilitate their interpretations as long-range deformations.
item.dc:creator: Rob Klabbers, Jules Lamers
